comment: This was one of my favorite classes that I took. Although there is a lot of reading to do, you are able to choose which stories to read which makes it a little better. There weren't that many essays either, it was probably like one or two. The most difficult part of the class would probably be the final project.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors I have ever had. If you put in the effort you will be rewarded. He notices and appreciates good work and will give those who try the grade they deserve. I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot from it. Would definitely take this professor again!

Prof. Crumps instructions are not clear, he changes due dates as he pleases, will say to read a passage from one of our two texts books but does not give pages number (these books are 1k pages each) his assignments are repatative and not helpful to this course, there is a semester wide project spread over each module that he grades seperate.
Do not take this guy, really really really bad. His instructions are somewhat clear but he does not use D2L that well. If you don't like free time, take him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great professor. Very detailed on how he is going to grade your assignments. This was my first online class and it was a great experience for me. You do get a substantial amount of work load but you will definitely learn a great amount. There is a lot of reading involved  and there are are assignments due every week. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: By far the worse professor I have ever taken online!! lots of reading and heavy homework load per week!!!! picky on everything from spelling, the choice of vocab used.  sarcastic and grades poorly!! I would never encourage anyone to take this course with this instructor .
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is the worst teacher I have ever had. Stay away! Takes 10 points off for every mistake. His notes/critiques are impossible to understand, or are very unhelpful. He does not care if you do the work. If you don't add quotes or cite properly he will fail you. If i could rate him as zero I would.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you read the material, you are guaranteed an A or B.  Easy class.  Takee him.

I would not recommend taking this class if you have a full load, or work full-time, but passing is definitely manageable. Be prepared for to do a lot of work and pay attention to details and his feedback for the reading journals. Despite having a low rating for easiness, getting an A is still very possible. Wouldn't take again but it could be worse

Took his online class, and it was fairly easy. Lots of work, but if you do it and follow all instructions you will get an A. Look at module intros, dropbox, and assignment documents for all instructions, which is confusing. Lots of reading/writing. It took me 2 days to get the entire 2 week module done. He responds quickly to all questions.

Took class online, would not recommend this instructor, there are too many other choices out there. Instructions for projects need to be assembled from multiple locations, so you are always missing something, every time.

Avoid at all costs. He is so rude and is not fair on his grading system. Very pickychoosy. He gave me awful grades on everything when I followed his instructions to a T. Seriously, don't take his class.

The class is hard, but if you follow directions you will pass. We had two reading journals a week that were based on a minimum of 15 page boring stories. His discussion post are where you will collect your points so make sure you do them. His essays aren't bad minimum 3-5 pages but the content counts a lot.

I would avoid this professor at all cost. I feel as though he doesn't have any respect for his students when he speaks to them and when they come to him for help. We have reading journals (book reports) that are utterly ridiculous and you have to do 2 at a time. The weekly discussion boards was the easiest part of the class.  AVOID HIM!!!

If you work full time, AVOID! Lots of assignments  2 reading journalsweek on stories that are 60+ pages long. Weekly discussions with two separate due dates for 1st post and the 5 comments.. Final project's directions are single spaced and 2 pgs long, which can cause the MULTIPLE due dates for this project to get lost. 2 essays over weird topics.

I wouldn't take this class again if I had the chance. I did everything like he asked & read everything he assigned, yet couldn't get good grades. He grades essays & journals ridiculously hard & irrationally. My word document had a technical malfunction & added 100 pages to my essay which he took points off for, which I found completely irrational.

ABSURDLY strict with grading on MLA, and the over-detailed reading journals, especially since the majority of the real world doesn't have a need to EVER write in MLA.  Entire letter grades deducted for trifling technical mistakes with 0 points deducted on the grammarcontent side.  Don't take this class from this prof.  Too much work required.

if you have alot of free time, take this class. It isnt impossible the professor was helpful but the assignments are huge. two reading journals every 2 weeks plus a blog type assignment. The Reading Journals are pretty vague on the first assignment and it takes you about as long as it does to read the story to finish them. not worth.

Yes, there is a lot of work but it's easy to do if you don't get distracted. I was really bad about turning stuff in on time and still got decent grades. He grades fairly. He took off 10 points on a paper I did for not having a works cited which I DID have and when I confronted him nicely he gave me my 10 points back and an extra 5 so I like him!

This class has a greater work load than anatomy. Detailed reading journals are harder than essays. You do about 6 of those, 2 essays on weird topics, and in depth discussions, project, final... I mean, It lit takes HOURS a day for the online class. Hard grader too! This guy obviously is IN LOVE with Literature and thinks everyone should be.

If you have a life i.e. kids, work, spouse, do not take this online class. This course is very very reading intensive. No tests, but the final. You have very detailed journals and posts to make plus 1 multimedia project. I am going to burn my 2 volumes of lit. next month in celebration!

He gives alot of work. I took him for the summer and he literally took 16 weeks and squeezed it into 8 weeks. Things got a little overwhelming but he is a good communicator. He emails back fast and he really wants his students to learn. He really cares about letting the mind grow.
Great professor~pushes you to do well
Good

STAY AWAY-Rediculous workload and pushes you to outside resources if you ask him a question.  In an 8 week summer semester there were 4 book reports, 2 essays, discussion boards, and an unimaginable amount of reading.  I was looking forward to a summer of reading enjoyment, what I got was a summer from HE##!  Do yourself a favor and don't take him.
This professor gives a RIDICULOUS WORKLOAD. Take him only if you want to FAIL. He is a spirit breaker, you will go into his class loving World Lit and come out hating the very word literature.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!! I would not take him! He really doesn't understand that we have lives outside of his class. I took his online class and it was nothing short of ridiculous. For some reason he decides to teach as if you are getting your masters! He Likes to make things extremely difficult!!!! DON'T TAKE HIM IF YOU WANT A GOOD GRADE!!
He is not a good professor! He has a huge work load.  Every assignment is out of the text book and he is very one sided.

HE IS GREAT! I really got a long out of this class, and his assignmenets are not the normal assignments that you would get with any other teacher. There is a lot of work, but I took him online and I fee like his assignments could easy be spread our through a one week span. TAKE HIM!

Took his online class & it was ridiculous! This guy does not understand that his class is not our only priority. His assignments are unnecessarily long & never seem to end. I have never had to do so much work for an undergrad class! & if you try to ask him questions he will respond to them in a sarcastic way & make you feel stupid. DON'T TAKE HIM

Took his online class and really enjoyed it.  Weekly discussion over reading materials but they are usually short.  Easy grader.  I'm terrible at writing but I've gotten a 95 and 100 on the two essays. (They only have to be 3-5 pages and it's not research just personal opinion)  I would definitely take him again.

Took his online class and loved it. Much better than the normal english teacher. Keeps busy with weeks, but very fair with grading. Quick to respond to emails. Gives feedback to assignments. Recommend him highly, he's awesome if you work hard on your stuff.
